text: When will HubSpot 3.0 launch?
what is HubSpot 3.0
are you storing your images in teh file manager? You should be able to just "copy url" from the file manager

Hey <@UK01K86CB> by 3.0, I believe you are referring to a number of our tools such as:
• *Local development using the CLI:* where you can see more on this in our <#CLJJXGTC0|local-development> channel
• *Drag and Drop Templates:* where you can use the dnd_area tags in templates. More on this here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags/dnd-areas>
• *Themes:* Where you can see more on this in our <#CSFGKSHT7|themes> channel
If you have any questions on those, feel free to ask away in those channels. You can also DM me with any questions and I can help you out as well :slightly_smiling_face:
Is there any way to spoof the “last updated” date on a blog post so it shows a date in the past?
I’m assuming no
yes
publish date?
or no
Also, what last updated to you want to change? Like in the blog post that a user sees?
Yeah.  <https://www.visioncritical.com/blog/our-commitment-to-our-employees-and-customers-during-covid-19>
```<span class="postDate">Last updated <span>{{ content.updated|datetimeformat('%B %d, %Y') }}</span></span>```
Ehh. Not exactly sure. I would use a field, export to template templete context and just do a `{{ module.dateoverride || content.update }}`
type thing... lol I did that code pretty terrible <@U54TVT3C1>
I don’t know if this was you <@U25PYL3Q8>
Not a big deal no matter what
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/functions#update>
I wonder if you can call that on the content.* attributes. Probably not advised :smile:
I’d be concerned I’d accidentally update the `content.update` on all of my blog posts
in the loop? or in the database?
in the loop I guess
it wouldn’t impact the database - that’d be a disaster :smile:
i’ll give it a try in a bit
I mean, I guess I could wrap it in a conditional based on the post title or something
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-blog/how-can-i-edit-my-blog-post-s-publish-date-and-time>
is that what you want to do?

Unfortunately no.  We tag our posts with the last updated time.  We order them by publish date though.  It’s really a no big deal situation.

Nice to have more than necessary
Thanks for that!
